title: Senior Technology Architect - US
text:
Infosys– Financial Services– Senior Technology Architect – BlockChainInfosys is a global leader in technology services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to create and execute strategies for their digital transformation. From engineering to application development, knowledge management and business process management, we help our clients find the right problems to solve, and to solve these effectively. Our team of 200,000 innovators, across the globe, is differentiated by the imagination, knowledge and experience, across industries and technologies, that we bring to every project we undertake.Wanted: Global Innovators To Help Us Build Tomorrow’s EnterpriseAs a Senior Technology Architect, you will provide best-fit architectural solutions for one or more projects; provide technology consultation; assist in defining scope and sizing of work; anchor Proof of Concept developments and support opportunity identification and pursuit processes and evangelize Infosys brand. 



 You will collaborate with some of the best talent in the industry to create and implement innovative high quality solutions, lead and participate in sales and pursuits focused on our clients' business needs. You will be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued.Location for this position is New Jersey/NewYork .This position may require travel and/or relocation.U.S. citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. 



 We are unable to sponsor at this time.QualificationsBasic
• Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.
• At least 11 years of experience with Information Technology.Preferred
• At least 12 years of experience in block chain platforms (Hyperledger, Ethereum, R3 Corda), Docker, Java Script, React.JS, Node.JS, jQuery, Ajax, Solidity, AngularJS, Cloud(AWS or Azure)
• Sound understanding of Block chain framework such as Hyperledger Fabric, R3 Corda, Ethereum (Solidity), Ripple, Multichain.
• Strong in fundamental Architecture principles, and has strong J2EE Architecture & Development background.
• Fosters open communication between team members
• Good understanding of various different consensus algorithms used in Bitcoin Blockchain, Ethereum, Byzantine fault-tolerant algorithms including Hyperledger Fabric PBFT algorithm etc.
• Good understanding of using cryptography material such as certificates for identity management in order to authenticate members, transactions etc.
• Ability to architect and design integration architecture for integrating applications with Blockchain and, also, participant organizations and their member nodes to Blockchain network.
• Understanding of cryptography, including asymmetric (pub/priv key), symmetric, hash functions, encryption/signatures.
• Proficient with one or more programming languages such as Go, Java, NodeJS, Solidity,Kotlin
• Create risk /failure analysis and prepare risk mitigation plan
• Understanding of market and technology trends.
• Analytical skills
• Experience and desire to work in a Global delivery environment The job entails an extensive amount of travel. The job also entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email or face to face.About UsInfosys is a global leader in consulting, technology and outsourcing solutions. 



 We enable clients, in more than 30 countries, to stay a step ahead of emerging business trends and outperform the competition. We help them transform and thrive in a changing world by co-creating breakthrough solutions that combine strategic insights and execution excellence.EOE/Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin

title: Ethereum Developer - 100% REMOTE
text:
We are a fully funded blockchain startup that's looking to change the way that financial corporations communicate. Because of our recent influx of clients, we are looking to expand our development team. We currently have a team of about 50 employees based in Los Angeles - several engineers already work fully remote and we have all the tools for you to do so.

 

 This is a brand new opening for an Ethereum expert! We are hoping you have at least 5+ years of professional development experience on AWS, and at least one year of working professionally with Ethereum.

 

 If you're looking for the flexibility to work from home, apply today!

What You Need for this Position

What's In It for You

So, if you are a Ethereum Developer - 100% REMOTE with experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.– In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

summary: ConsenSys was started by co-founder of Ethereum Joseph Lubin, with over 50 projects and 1,000+ members around the world....
title: Sr. BlockChain Protocol Engineer - Kaleido
text:
• Strong back-end development experience using one of GO, Rust or Java
• Hands on experience in basic cryptography such as digital signature, encryption based on asymmetric or symmetric keys, key agreement
• Being able to explain consensus algorithms like Raft or Paxos, PBFT
• Excellent communicator who works well in extremely fast-paced team environments
• Thrives in chaos and is comfortable with the uncertainty and the rapid change of R&D projects
• Self-starter who can define and execute tasks with minimal guidance
• Knowledge in advanced cryptography a big plus such as group signature, zero knowledge proofs

Kaleido is a rapidly growing start-up aiming to make blockchain radically simple for organizations to adopt so that our societies will fully benefit from decentralized models and technologies. Kaleido, A ConsenSys Business, has partnered with Amazon Web Services to offer it's Blockchain Business Cloud -- the first all-in-one SaaS platform built for Enterprise Blockchain. It dramatically accelerates and simplifies private blockchain network creation and operation with click-button simplicity saving organizations months and millions in the process.Kaleido is set apart by its collaborative culture focused on putting people first and that's manifested in how we interact with each other, how we build products and solutions, and how we deliver them to our customers.We move fast, put real product in customers' hands, and iterate and learn as we move towards scale. This will allow you to make an immediate, high impact within a dedicated, and nimble team.Blockchain is a rapidly developing technology and we're excited to be one of the first pioneers in the field. Our team comes with deep technical experience and a dedication to our mission, but we still like to have fun and take full advantage of our startup environment by playing ping pong and foosball during breaks, enjoying a beer from the tap after work, team outings and more. Our team, based in urban startup hub Raleigh, NC., is continually growing and looking for more like-minded individuals. Find out more at https://kaleido.io ( https://kaleido.io )Kaleido is incubated by ConsenSys, a venture production studio and the leading technology firm in blockchain globally. ConsenSys was started by co-founder of Ethereum Joseph Lubin, with over 50 projects and 1,000+ members around the world. The ConsenSys mission is to use the decentralized solutions from its projects to fundamentally reshape the economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet.We're looking for a Sr. Blockchain Protocol Engineer - to join our agile development team focused on the deep blockchain layer. As active participants in the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance (EEA) and contributors to multiple open source projects (Quorum, Hyperledger Fabric), our protocol team is at the forefront of Enterprise adoption of blockchain technology. In addition to solving the challenge of running and scaling permissioned blockchain networks in mission-critical Enterprise use cases, this role is also working with open source communities around data privacy, cross-chain interoperability, using technique such as zero knowledge proofs and state channels. Blockchain is a rapidly evolving technology area that has attracted a lot of brilliant minds around the world both in academia and industry. This role will be on the bleeding edge of this exciting movement.A successful candidate will have opportunities to research and develop innovative approaches to some of the most challenging problems in software such as advanced cryptography and distributed systems.NICE TO HAVEKaleido is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and deeply values diversity. We strive to create an inclusive environment for the diverse cultures, perspectives, and experiences in our workforce.

title: Cyber Threat Engineer-Darknet/Tor
text:
We are the Cyber & Investigative Technology Team at MITRE.

With us you will have the opportunity to work side-by-side with top-level investigators and the intelligence community to enhance the safety and security of our nation on a daily basis.

Our highly agile team enjoys a stable work program with long-term opportunities for career growth and development.

DescriptionNote: “While a security clearance is not required to start, this role requires a willingness to apply for and obtain a TS-SCI clearance.” The candidate must be willing to submit to a full background security check & pre-employment agreement.

summary: BitGo is pioneering true safety and security for digital currencies like Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple, Bitcoin Cash and many more....
title: Senior Product Manager - Custody
text:
BitGo is the market leader in institutional-grade cryptocurrency investment services providing security, compliance, and custodial solutions for blockchain-based currencies. BitGo is the world's largest processor of on-chain bitcoin transactions, processing 15% of all global Bitcoin transactions, and $15 billion per month across all cryptocurrencies. The company has over $2 billion in assets in wallet, and a customer base that includes the world's largest cryptocurrency exchanges and spans more than 50 countries. In 2018, it launched BitGo Trust Company, the first qualified custodian purpose-built for storing digital assets. BitGo is backed by Craft Ventures, DRW, Galaxy Digital Ventures, Goldman Sachs, Redpoint Ventures, and Valor Equity Partners.

BitGo is looking for a highly motivated Senior Product Manager who will join our Engineering Product team in Palo Alto.



Join BitGo’s fast-based product team as a Product Manager and help us to design, build and release cutting-edge blockchain products. You must thrive in a fast-paced environment, have strong understanding of software fundamentals, excellent communication skills, and a desire to work with technical teams to develop groundbreaking digital currency products.

Be a part of the team that is enabling digital currencies to extend beyond the fringe and into mainstream business. BitGo is pioneering true safety and security for digital currencies like Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple, Bitcoin Cash and many more. We’re growing and we’re winning.

We need great people who strive for excellence in all their endeavors and who have a track record of success. We are looking for candidates who are not risk averse and want to build products that will change the world. We aspire to foster a working environment, culture and leadership team that inspires greatness on a daily basis through transparency, ownership and integrity.
• Gain a deep understanding of customer needs, identify and fill product gaps and generate new ideas to drive growth
• Create buy-in for the product vision and translate product strategy into detailed requirements
• Scope and prioritize activities based on business and customer impact
• Lead multiple Palo Alto-based engineering teams to tackle technical complexities, organize and plan execution paths and deliver new products and features to the market
• Stay informed of the overall market landscape, including competitors and potential partners
• Evaluate promotional plans to ensure that they are consistent with product line strategy and that the message is effectively conveyed
• Proven work experience in financial services industry, preferably working with Institutional customers such as hedge funds, asset managers, OTC desks and/or exchanges
• Passion for driving product innovation and a track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
• Excellent written and verbal communications skills; ability to translate strategy into clear and actionable plans and effectively communicate cross functionally within Product Development, Engineering, Design and Sales.
• Strong problem solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done
• Curiosity to learn BitGo’s business and ability to adapt past experiences to BitGo’s current opportunities
• Ability to set priorities and work well independently

Disrupting an industry takes vision, innovation, passion, technical chops, drive to deliver, collaboration, and execution. Join a team of great people who strive for excellence and personify our corporate values of ownership, craftsmanship, and open communication. We are looking for new colleagues who bring innovative ways of thinking and problem solving, and who want risks to be part of the team that changes the world’s financial markets.

Here are some of the benefits of working at BitGo:
• Computer equipment and workplace furniture to suit your needs

Cryptocurrencies are the most disruptive change the financial services industry has seen in years. Join us and you’ll be able to look back and say you were part of the team that transformed investing.

summary: Familiarity with blockchain technologies (Hyperledger Fabric/Indy, Ethereum). In just 13 years, we have raised more than $1.1 billion in loan capital for 2.7...
title: Senior Platform Engineer, Kiva Protocol
text:
• Use blockchain technology to solve identity challenges and expand financial access in unbanked populations
• Contribute to the support and monitoring of the systems you create
• Implement simplicity-focused solutions for audiences that may have limited exposure to mobile and web-based technologies
• Help foster a spirit of innovation and collaboration both within the engineering team and across the organization
• Juggle a desire to move quickly with a passion for maintainable, well-crafted code
• A passion for best practices, fast delivery, and agile methodologies
• An amazing mission: Kiva's mission is to connect people through lending to alleviate poverty across the globe.
• An opportunity to improve real lives, solve hard problems, and change the world.
• Friendly, supportive, and adventurous environment with a team of engaged colleagues.
• Opportunities to connect with and learn from colleagues and partners around the world.

Kiva (www.kiva.org) is an innovative non-profit that combines the culture and technological passion of an internet start-up with the compassion and empathy of a non-profit to address poverty at global scale. In just 13 years, we have raised more than $1.1 billion in loan capital for 2.7 million borrowers in 83 countries. With offices in San Francisco, Portland, New York, Nairobi, and Bangkok, Kiva's team includes 100+ employees and 400+ volunteers worldwide.Recently announced at the United Nations General Assembly, Kiva is partnering with the government of Sierra Leone and United Nations to build a blockchain-based credit system that will unlock financial services for many of the world's poorest and most underbanked citizens. As a Senior Platform Engineer, you'll be a foundational member of a new team developing back-end technology to help populations across Sierra Leone (and ultimately the globe) escape poverty.The ideal candidate takes initiative and is passionate about both our organizational mission and our high standards in engineering. We produce results by giving engineers full ownership and the resources they need to work as efficiently as possible.This role will be based in San Francisco, Portland or Austin and will report to the Engineering Director based in San Francisco. At this time, we can only consider applicants with authorization to work in the United States on a permanent, full-time basis; unfortunately we cannot provide visa sponsorship.What We OfferA diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is an integral part of Kiva's culture. We actively welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a great place to work. Join us and help us achieve our mission!We will only accept applications directly from candidates. Kiva will not be responsible for any recruiting agency fees, absent a formal agreement.

summary: Familiarity with blockchain technologies such as HyperLedger, Ethereum and Solidity. Serebrum Corporation is a defense contractor developing innovative software...
title: Java Full Stack Developer (Mid-level)
text:
Company

Serebrum Corporation is a defense contractor developing innovative software solutions to tackle inefficient business processes. As a participant on the Federal SBIR program, Serebrum develops software products funded by Federal research grants, complemented by venture capital.

Job Description

We’re looking for (2) Full Stack developers who will take a key role on our team. Our Full Stack developer must have knowledge in all stages of software development. The product is based on Hyperledger/Ethereum blockchain platform to manage acquisitions. Development methodology is Agile with monthly sprints.

Design overall architecture of the web application.

Maintain quality and ensure responsiveness of applications.

Collaborate with the rest of the engineering team to design and launch new features.

Maintain code integrity and organization. Participate in peer reviews.

Experience working with graphic designers and converting designs to visual elements.

Understanding and implementation of security and data protection.

Highly experienced with back-end programming languages (Java mostly, some Python, C#)

Proficient experience using advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks such as AngularJS, ReactJS

Experience with data models and database development (MySQL, MongoDB, CouchDB)

Development experience for both mobile and desktop, in addition to the Web.

Experience with cloud message APIs and usage of push notifications.

Knowledge of code versioning tools such as Git, Amazon AWS DevOps environment.

Familiarity with blockchain technologies such as HyperLedger, Ethereum and Solidity. Ability and willingness to learn if no experience.

Benefits and Perks

Serebrum offers excellent compensation above industry standards, in the top quartile. Serebrum offers health insurance plans, paid vacation, 401(k) and life insurance.

**THE PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO KICKOFF AROUND MAY 1, 2019**POSITIONS ARE CONTINGENT ON FINAL AWARD**US CITIZENS ONLY DUE TO FEDERAL SECURITY RESTRICTIONS*

summary: Experience with at least one blockchain technology such as Hyperledger, Ethereum, Corda etc…. At Object Frontier, Inc....
title: Java Technical Architect
text:
At Object Frontier, Inc. we employ emerging digital technology advancements in innovative ways to help our clients drive revenue. Our clients trust us to deliver innovative products that lead to digital transformation. We have earned the trust of both large and small firms since 1997. We build software. And trust. 

 

 For the 3rd year in a row, Object Frontier has been named to Inc. Magazine’s list of the 5000 fastest growing companies in America. Due to this impressive growth, we are seeking a Java Technical Architect, contract or direct hire, to add to our team at our Alpharetta headquarters.

We offer a dynamic, team-oriented environment for consultative, results-focused professionals. This key member of the TIEO team will report to the Technical Architect Manager and is expected to represent OFS according to the highest professional and ethical standards.
• Should be able to work with Prospects and Customers for requirement understanding and problem statement definition.
• Requires in-depth knowledge of designing and building applications using Service Oriented Architecture.
• Requires strong knowledge of enterprise architecture and design patterns. Experience in using UML and Modelling tools.
• Well versed in developing APIs and micro-services.
• Should have good exposure to continuously integrated and delivered environment (CI/CD) using tools.
• Complete tasks assigned within Agile Scrum team for a given sprint.
• Experience with at least one blockchain technology such as Hyperledger, Ethereum, Corda etc…
• Experience delivering working prototypes and preferably real world implementations of blockchain technology in a specific, or multiple, industries.
• Hands-on technical programming and development skills in any or multiple of languages such as C++, Java, Node Js, GO, Python.

Object Frontier, Inc. is committed to creating and maintaining a diverse workforce. We consider applicants for all positions without regard to age, race, sex (including pregnancy), color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, status as a qualified individual with a disability, protected veteran, or other status protected by law.

text:

• Excellent listening and communication skills, coupled with strong interpersonal and relationship management skills
• Ability to motivate others to do complicated tasks and fulfill their potential

title: Director of Customer Support
text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

The Customer Support team at Gemini is a team group of highly talented and dynamic contributors. Each individual ensures that our customers have the best experience possible when they need help, have a question or are providing feedback. This team manages all inbound service requests, communications with customers while onboarding, and is increasingly contributing to outbound communications. The Customer Support teams main focus is our Retail customers, but increasingly they are interacting with Institutional Customers. During periods of low-service volume, the team also takes on support-centric projects.

Gemini is looking for a self-motivated, personable, hands-on individual who is experienced and eager to lead the Customer Support team. As the leader of our Customer Support Team, you’ll directly manage a team associates in NYC, as well as lead a remote support team. You’ll be responsible for ensuring the quality of our service remains best-in-class, maximizing efficiency, developing relationships with other departments to ensure our customers’ needs are being met, and continuing to build upon the team’s rapidly evolving infrastructure.

This position is full-time at Gemini’s offices in New York City, and will report to the Managing Director of Operations.
• Lead and inspire a growing team of Gemini Customer Support associates, as well as a remote team, to deliver exceptional customer support
• Drive customer satisfaction and retention through initial customer onboarding, ongoing support and retention initiatives
• Manage client insights function to develop a proactive client services model, inform on business initiatives, and report on trends in the fast-paced world of cryptocurrencies
• Advocate as the voice of the customer within Gemini when collaborating cross-functionally with Marketing, Finance, Product & Engineering teams
• Work with Managing Director of Operations in revamping a new support service model
• Define and drive key performance indicators (KPIs) for the customer support team
• 6-10 years of professional experience in Customer Support, with 3-5 years of management experience with Customer Support or Client Services teams
• Experience with with retail customer support, familiarity with institutional support a plus
• Experience in financial services or fintech support
• Proficiency in leveraging a range of tools to build and communicate data-driven recommendations
• Excellent listening and communication skills, coupled with strong interpersonal and relationship management skills
• Ability to motivate others to do complicated tasks and fulfill their potential
• Adaptability to manage uncertainty; balancing multiple competing objectives and timelines, and making sensible compromises to push your team forward. Ability to take on new initiatives and build them into the customer service team’s workflow.
• Problem solver, creative thinker, and not afraid to experiment

It Pays to Work Here

We take a holistic approach to compensation at Gemini, which includes:
• Ownership in the company via profit sharing units

Gemini is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

summary: Cryptocurrencies (Bitcoin, Ethereum). Are you a passionate FinTech Professional with a knack for changing lives?...
title: Curriculum Engineer (FinTech)
text:
• Someone with at least 3+ years of industry experience in the financial technology sector. This is a great place to build your skills and learn new ones!
• Someone with a lot of hands-on experience. We're building a program in which students learn by doing! At a minimum, you should have a strong familiarity with tools like:
• Someone who absolutely loves teaching and sharing knowledge with others. It's ideal if you've taught financial technology or programming in the past. Major plus if you've spoken at fintech conferences.
• Someone with a creative itch! This program will require a great deal of ingenuity and setup to create at scale. We want someone who is excited by the idea of creating KYC applications in blockchain or machine learning powered trading algorithms.
• Someone who is a lot of fun! We want learning technology to be exciting, engaging, and a little funny. Imagine an engineering class that feels like a Disney movie. We need fun people to make this a reality.
• Someone who can manage a team. We've got a team of brilliant curriculum developers who can build amazing modules. We want someone who can bring expertise and new vision to the program. We're looking for a true tech titan.
• Someone who isn't afraid to get their hands dirty. In this capacity, you'll be responsible for keeping a living curriculum up-to-date for hundreds of Instructors and TAs across the country. This means managing issues, pull requests, and bug fixes. It also means taking in community input on technology trends. We need someone with a bit of thick skin, an infectious enthusiasm for continual improvement, and an ability to maintain a community of professionals.
• Someone who is looking for more than just a paycheck. We can't stress this enough. Deep within all of us at Trilogy is the belief that our programs change lives. Each month we hear from countless students attesting to how our program brought them new skills, landed them new jobs, and a renewed sense of confidence. This impact is what our work is really about to us.
• You will be responsible for dreaming up and creating instructional activities for demonstrating key concepts in the area of financial technology.
• You will be responsible for improving portions of our curriculum based on student learning data -- and continually asked to create improved content for teaching topics covered in our program.
• You will be responsible for staying abreast of technology trends and incorporate these trends into the curriculum.
• Lastly and most importantly, you will be responsible for making sure our program is the very best financial technology training program it can be. We want the person in this role to feel accountable to our students' success in the same way we hold ourselves accountable to their success in all other areas.

Are you a passionate FinTech Professional with a knack for changing lives? Do you love writing, teaching, and storytelling as much as you love writing Python code? Are you a Blockchain wizard who loves discussing the latest trends in the field? Then we may have the position for you.At Trilogy Education Services, we're creating programs to train new audiences for careers in the tech industry. Our programs are taught at the leading universities across the country including the University of Pennsylvania, University of California Berkeley, Northwestern, UNC Chapel Hill, Rutgers, UT Austin, and many others. We pride ourselves on building high-quality programs that help ambitious, hardworking adults change their lives through practical skills, fundamental knowledge, and the confidence to advance their careers.We're looking for a top-notch FinTech professional with a love for teaching, inspiring, and helping newcomers enter the field of financial technology. The program we're developing combines theoretical teaching with plenty of hands-on practical, skills-based training.Trilogy Education Services ( http://www.trilogyed.com/ ) is a Workforce Accelerator whose mission is to empower universities to transform the lives of students by preparing them for high-growth careers in the Digital Economy. We create and manage skills-based training programs that are university-run, student-tested, and employer-approved. Each Trilogy program is individually designed to meet the needs of regional employers, and to ensure that students graduate with both technical skills and personal confidence to succeed in their careers. The world's leading universities, including Northwestern School of Professional Studies, UC Berkeley Extension, and Rutgers Division of Continuing Studies, trust Trilogy to help their students meet the needs of the Digital Economy.We're a rapidly growing and established education company with thousands of students enrolled in our programs. We're data-driven -- with a startup like culture and tremendous opportunities to have a huge impact.Oh. And we're a ridiculously fun place to work.

Curriculum Success ManagerFull-TimeNYC / SF / Remoteup to 25%At Trilogy Education Services, we're creating innovative programs to train new audiences for careers in the digital economy. We're looking for people with passion, a demonstrated ability to learn on their feet, and a desire to escape the cubicle and stretch their creative muscles in new ways.The Academics team is looking for a talented and organized Curriculum Success Manager who can demonstrate effective communication, project management, and technical review skills to support a dedicated team of content developers supporting our customer facing 24-week classroom programs.This role will work with our Curriculum Manager and Curriculum Architect to help develop/support a standard review process for our content development by partnering with instructors and SMEs to ensure our content is providing a world class experience. This role will also provide operational support with curriculum pilots and launches.

title: Hyperledger Architect
text:
We are seeking an exceptional Hyperledger Architect to help us design the next generation of digital infrastructures. summary: Invent 2018, Amazon Managed Blockchain is a fully managed service that makes it easy for customers to create and managed scalable blockchain networks using the...
title: Senior Software Development Engineer – Amazon Managed Blockc...
text:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent work experience
• Own the software development process end-to-end, including working with stakeholders to determine requirements, designing, architecting, planning, implementing, testing, and operating new systems and features
• Bring a deep understanding of software development in a team, software development methodologies and scheduling, a track record of shipping software on time and services development to this high-accountability role
• Actively participate in hiring talented people and assist in the career development of others both on and outside your team, mentoring individuals and helping other managers guide the career growth of their team members
• Play a critical role in developing the broad plan for the business, working closely with senior executives to develop business targets and resource requirements. Help form long-term technical and business strategy and goals
• Have experience operating services to deliver both high quality and high availability
• Have experience with distributed systems, and experience building blockchain and data processing solutions is a plus
• Engaging with and contributing to relevant open source projects

Want to work with cutting-edge technologies like distributed databases, blockchain, cryptography, and cloud computing? Interested in helping customers leverage new technologies to solve innovative use cases? Come join the Amazon Managed Blockchain team!Invent 2018, Amazon Managed Blockchain is a fully managed service that makes it easy for customers to create and managed scalable blockchain networks using the popular open source frameworks Hyperledger Fabric and Ethereum. The Amazon Managed Blockchain team is looking for an experienced Software Development Engineer who is passionate about building new products from the ground up and has an entrepreneurial approach to building new services for customers. The ideal candidate for this position has a proven track record of delivering outstanding products at scale and is passionate blockchain, distributed systems, containers, cryptography, distributed ledgers, and cloud scale software. You would be a core part of defining the technical direction and culture of this new team. This is a great opportunity for you to interact directly with customers and influence definition and design from scratch.https://aws.amazon.com/managed-blockchain/We are building new AWS services and features from the ground up, offering a unique opportunity for engineers who want to help define, design, build, and operate cloud services that are changing the world and enabling our customers. Additionally, you will get to collaborate with some of the best and brightest minds in the industry and join a fast-paced and growing team in one of the most innovative technology companies. Come join us to Work Hard, Have Fun, and Make History!

• You will be responsible for staying abreast of technology trends and incorporate these trends into the curriculum.
• Lastly and most importantly, you will be responsible for making sure our program is the very best financial technology training program it can be. We want the person in this role to feel accountable to our students' success in the same way we hold ourselves accountable to their success in all other areas.

Are you a passionate FinTech Professional with a knack for changing lives? Do you love writing, teaching, and storytelling as much as you love writing Python code? Are you a Blockchain wizard who loves discussing the latest trends in the field? Then we may have the position for you.At Trilogy Education Services, we're creating programs to train new audiences for careers in the tech industry. Our programs are taught at the leading universities across the country including the University of Pennsylvania, University of California Berkeley, Northwestern, UNC Chapel Hill, Rutgers, UT Austin, and many others. We pride ourselves on building high-quality programs that help ambitious, hardworking adults change their lives through practical skills, fundamental knowledge, and the confidence to advance their careers.We're looking for a top-notch FinTech professional with a love for teaching, inspiring, and helping newcomers enter the field of financial technology. The program we're developing combines theoretical teaching with plenty of hands-on practical, skills-based training.Trilogy Education Services ( http://www.trilogyed.com/ ) is a Workforce Accelerator whose mission is to empower universities to transform the lives of students by preparing them for high-growth careers in the Digital Economy. We create and manage skills-based training programs that are university-run, student-tested, and employer-approved. Each Trilogy program is individually designed to meet the needs of regional employers, and to ensure that students graduate with both technical skills and personal confidence to succeed in their careers. The world's leading universities, including Northwestern School of Professional Studies, UC Berkeley Extension, and Rutgers Division of Continuing Studies, trust Trilogy to help their students meet the needs of the Digital Economy.We're a rapidly growing and established education company with thousands of students enrolled in our programs. We're data-driven -- with a startup like culture and tremendous opportunities to have a huge impact.Oh. And we're a ridiculously fun place to work.

This will include showcasing working with AWS blockchain templates (Hyperledger Fabric, Ethereum), AWS IoT, API Gateway, and Lambda.Seattle or Los Angeles, but other major US metros also considered.

title: Talent Manager
text:
Ethereum Classic Labs is committed to developing a vibrant ecosystem for the Ethereum Classic Blockchain (ETC). We do this by supporting core development projects, and entrepreneurs and their enterprises. The Labs manages an incubator, which hosts up to 25 start ups annually, providing investment, mentorship, office space, and support. The Labs also hosts a blockchain research and development team, building software to strengthen the ETC blockchain.

ETC Labs is hiring a Talent Manager to help the Labs grow and thrive. She/he will work closely with the CEO of ETC Labs and management team to recruit and retain a team of professionals; and maintain and enhance the organization's human resources by planning, implementing, and evaluating employee relations and human resources policies, programs, and practices.

The Talent Manager will have responsibilities in the following areas:
• Identify, refine, and fulfill talent needs and job descriptions.
• Engage with potential candidates through the entire recruitment process.

• Ensure legal compliance by monitoring and implementing applicable human resource federal and state requirements; conducting investigations; and maintaining records.
• Maintains historical human resource records by designing a filing and retrieval system; keeping past and current records.
• Fluent in Chinese language is a Must.

The ETC Labs is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender identity. We value, celebrate, and encourage diversity.

title: Software Engineer, Security
text:
• Performing vulnerability assessments and code reviews/audits as well as developing tools to enhance & automate our security systems/processes and procedures
• Assessing application risks and partnering with development teams to recommend mitigation strategies
• Responding to security incidents and developing operations to detect potential incidents

title: Electronic Discovery & Litigation Support Analyst
text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

Gemini is seeking an Electronic Discovery (eDiscovery) and Litigation Support Subject Matter Expert (SME) to provide project management, guidance and technical expertise for an Enterprise eDiscovery practice and response. This individual will be working alongside internal and external investigators, internal and external counsel, and other entities to ensure compliance with and efficient responses to electronic discovery matters.
• Assist with the execution of an eDiscovery System program (investigators, management, attorneys, paralegals, project managers, etc.)
• Perform complex collections and searches, create workspaces and templates, designs workflows appropriate for data sets, and provides consultative support on best practices
• Coordinate documentation development as deliverables, such as Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), User Guidance.
• Develop eDiscovery workflows for the finding and collection of requested material
• Coordinate reviews and assist with analysis and processing as directed by counsel.
• Ensure the accuracy of data collected, manipulation, and conversion by performing and documenting quality checks.
• Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in the eDiscovery or forensics field
• Five (5) years of hands-on Electronic Discovery experience in the litigation support technology field
• Ability to work independently and excel in a high tempo operational environment
• Ability to define and analyze problems, and develop solutions

It Pays to Work Here

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Our tight-knit team is comprised of recruiters, program managers, and human resources specialists, and our job is a big one: create best-in-class processes and programs that find, grow, and retain amazing talent at Gemini. text:
Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a next generation digital asset exchange and custodian that allows customers to buy, sell, and store digital assets such as bitcoin and ether. title: Strategy and Operations Senior Associate (PegaSys)
text:
• Support the continuous evolution and execution of PegaSys' vision, strategy and go-to-market
• Guide activities to create a developer community around our products
• Help the many projects that PegaSys supports launch effectively
• Provide project management support/skills to R&D projects on an ongoing basis

• Biased towards action—you're not afraid to roll up your sleeves and just get things done

• Interested in deep technological problems and fascinated by the cutting-edge

• Demonstrated analytical skills. You know what questions to ask of data and are comfortable with Excel

• Optionally: the most interesting book you've read in 2017

The RoleThis highly visible role will help to bring PegaSys' products to market. This role is both strategic and operational. Your responsibilities will include: support strategic programs and help implement those programs, oversee operations for PegaSys teams such as R&D, support larger efforts to scale PegaSys products, position PegaSys within a complex and rapidly evolving market, and support business development efforts for clients and partnerships.This role will be part of the PegaSys Operations and Strategy team. We work closely with PegaSys and ConsenSys leadership, senior clients in numerous industries, and the Ethereum community.Key DutiesYou areRequirementsWe do not expect every applicant to meet all of the requirements. If you think you meet some of the requirements, and you're excited about the role, we welcome you to apply.PreferredWhen we interview you, we will be looking for people with high levels of emotional intelligence who are intellectually curious, and have the ability to communicate cross-culturally always being professional, dynamic in conversation, charismatic, and persuasive.You must be able to ask specific yet articulate questions, quickly synthesize insights from patterns in conversation, and reflect back the key points from a conversation in order to get alignment, commitments, and lay out next steps.About ConsenSysConsenSys is focused on building and scaling tools and software products for the Ethereum blockchain. Our mission is to use these solutions to empower decentralized networks for social, political, and business related use cases.Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, security and infrastructure, and more. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.The Protocol Engineering Group (PegaSys) team within ConsenSys creates and contributes to the software which operates Ethereum networks from the public chain to enterprise ecosystems. PegaSys is on a mission to enable the decentralized future by building a next-generation enterprise-grade blockchain platform.Want to learn more?If what we've described above feels exciting and challenging to you, please apply below with the following:

summary: ConsenSys was started by co-founder of Ethereum Joseph Lubin, with over 50 projects and 1,000+ members around the world....
title: BlockChain Protocol Engineer - Kaleido
text:
• Strong back-end development experience using one of GO, Rust or Java
• Hands on experience in basic cryptography such as digital signature, encryption based on asymmetric or symmetric keys, key agreement
• Being able to explain consensus algorithms like Raft or Paxos, PBFT
• Excellent communicator who works well in extremely fast-paced team environments
• Thrives in chaos and is comfortable with the uncertainty and the rapid change of R&D projects
• Self-starter who can define and execute tasks with minimal guidance
• Knowledge in advanced cryptography a big plus such as group signature, zero knowledge proofs

Kaleido is a rapidly growing start-up aiming to make blockchain radically simple for organizations to adopt so that our societies will fully benefit from decentralized models and technologies. Kaleido, A ConsenSys Business, has partnered with Amazon Web Services to offer it's Blockchain Business Cloud -- the first all-in-one SaaS platform built for Enterprise Blockchain. It dramatically accelerates and simplifies private blockchain network creation and operation with click-button simplicity saving organizations months and millions in the process.Kaleido is set apart by its collaborative culture focused on putting people first and that's manifested in how we interact with each other, how we build products and solutions, and how we deliver them to our customers.We move fast, put real product in customers' hands, and iterate and learn as we move towards scale. This will allow you to make an immediate, high impact within a dedicated, and nimble team.Blockchain is a rapidly developing technology and we're excited to be one of the first pioneers in the field. Our team comes with deep technical experience and a dedication to our mission, but we still like to have fun and take full advantage of our startup environment by playing ping pong and foosball during breaks, enjoying a beer from the tap after work, team outings and more. Our team, based in urban startup hub Raleigh, NC., is continually growing and looking for more like-minded individuals. Find out more at https://kaleido.io ( https://kaleido.io )Kaleido is incubated by ConsenSys, a venture production studio and the leading technology firm in blockchain globally. ConsenSys was started by co-founder of Ethereum Joseph Lubin, with over 50 projects and 1,000+ members around the world. The ConsenSys mission is to use the decentralized solutions from its projects to fundamentally reshape the economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet.We're looking for a Protocol Engineer - to join our agile development team focused on the deep blockchain layer. As active participants in the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance (EEA) and contributors to multiple open source projects (Quorum, Hyperledger Fabric), our protocol team is at the forefront of Enterprise adoption of blockchain technology. In addition to solving the challenge of running and scaling permissioned blockchain networks in mission-critical Enterprise use cases, this role is also working with open source communities around data privacy, cross-chain interoperability, using technique such as zero knowledge proofs and state channels. Blockchain is a rapidly evolving technology area that has attracted a lot of brilliant minds around the world both in academia and industry. This role will be on the bleeding edge of this exciting movement.A successful candidate will have opportunities to research and develop innovative approaches to some of the most challenging problems in software such as advanced cryptography and distributed systems.NICE TO HAVEKaleido is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and deeply values diversity. We strive to create an inclusive environment for the diverse cultures, perspectives, and experiences in our workforce.

title: Trading Systems Engineer
text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.



Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

Working with our team of core trading systems developers to improve and expand the functionality of our matching engine, order entry mechanisms, and market data publication. We design, develop, deploy, and support real-time systems for our digital asset trading platform. Time is measured in microseconds and we aim to start measuring in nanoseconds. Reliability, fault tolerance, recoverability, throughput, and latency are what we look for in our systems. If something on the spaceship is broken we aim to fix it, if something can be automated we automate it, and we ship our code weekly.
• Use engineering principles to identify and measure risk and to implement quantitative and technical risk management solutions in software
• Understand business needs, facilitate and develop process workflows, data requirements, and specifications required to support implementation of our real time exchange
• Develop scalable architecture for future state of our exchange and contribute towards improving the trading infrastructure.
• Write robust code and APIs to support the company’s vital business
• Keep everyone informed about the health and viability of the platform by reporting known issues and status of ongoing investigations.
• Identify and advocate for changes vital to the stability and supportability of the system.
• Mentor and advise teammates to ensure new features are efficient, highly available, and fault tolerant.
• Provide continuity and stability to the production environment.
• Provide quick response to production issues to help eliminate down time thereby ensuring high availability and performance of our trading platform.
• Coordinate, prioritize and plan the changes to our trading software thereby ensuring smooth exchange migrations, quick time to market for new features and software.
• 3+ years working with FIX or other market data/order protocols

If you are someone that thrives in an exciting environment where being disciplined, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.The Protocol Engineering Group (PegaSys) team within ConsenSys creates and contributes to the software which operates Ethereum networks from the public chain to enterprise ecosystems. PegaSys is on a mission to enable the decentralized future by building a next-generation enterprise-grade blockchain platform.We are set to grow the ecosystem around blockchain and technologies through products that drive enterprise adoption. title: Legal Assistant
text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. The Legal department at Gemini is making history, paving the way when it comes to applying the legacy of law to the future of digital assets. On this team, we tackle complex and unprecedented applications of the current legal system to the revolutionary industry of cryptocurrency and blockchain technology. At Gemini, Legal plays a critical role in guiding innovation and driving value for the business, while upholding our core tenets of security, compliance, and trust for our customers. Join us and help define the Legal Department of the Future.

An excellent legal assistant is the backbone of a successful Legal Department. In this role, you will roll up your sleeves to create and improve processes, maintain records, and conduct legal research in the unchartered territory of digital assets, cryptocurrency, and blockchain technology. Working alongside the General Counsel and the rest of the Legal team, you will partner closely with key internal stakeholders across Engineering, Product, Compliance, Finance, Business Development, and Operations as we work to solve novel legal challenges in this groundbreaking territory.
• Provide exceptional, responsive, and meticulous support to a wide variety of projects undertaken by the Legal team.
• Successfully liaise with Leadership across all of Gemini’s internal departments, ensuring the employment of legal considerations when helping to solve problems and handling inbound requests.
• Research and deliver findings in the fintech and crypto industries that will help drive innovation for implementing legal policies across regions.
• Handle corporate governance matters and manage processes, policies, and formalities associated with Gemini’s status as a regulated trust company.
• Proactively manage tasks, including drafting agreements, processing and negotiating NDAs, data entry, organizing legal documents, and responding to subpoenas for employment legal records - all done in a timely and highly organized manner.
• Aid in the building of a nimble, impactful Legal function at Gemini
• Authorization to work in the United States and fluency in English.
• Ability to manage and prioritize numerous projects simultaneously in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.
• Flexibility and willingness to work on a broad range of legal matters.
• Demonstrated interest in disruptive technology and desire to learn.
• Ability to be a proactive self-starter who can thrive in ambiguity.

text:
HELP US BUILD THE FUTURE OF MONEY

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Our Infrastructure team is responsible for building and operating Gemini's world class crypto exchange systems and networks. The SREs are specifically responsible for building, automating, and scaling our growing server footprint and product offerings. Our infrastructure is a combination of high speed datacenter-based equipment and cloud hosted components.

This individual will be responsible for helping maintain the networking and systems environments along with developing new processes to simplify our support model, built with a reliability mindset. We are looking for a hands-on operational technologist to drive the modernization and resiliency of our architecture on both AWS and bare-metal systems. The ideal candidate will have sound experience in managing a staff dedicated to the operational excellence of our technology infrastructure.This role reports to our CIO.
• Ensure the successful preparation, deployment, monitoring, and reliable operation of Gemini’s infrastructure across multiple datacenters.
• Develop and maintain Key Performance Indicators of Gemini’s infrastructure providing strategic visibility of the platforms capabilities.
• Manage, mentor, and lead staff, providing guidance, training and motivation as necessary to develop team members.
• Cultivate expertise in the team's subject matter including its bare-mental & cloud architecture as well as any other supporting technology components
• Provide timely communications and response to key stakeholders and external clients with respect to the operations of our exchange and infrastructure
• Identify opportunities for continuous improvement by leading quality initiatives to improve the delivery of service levels.
• Maintain responsibility for delivering hardware and software maintenance and ensuring uptime of critical technology for our clients.
• Experience in capital markets (e.g., exchange, market maker, latency-sensitive broker etc.) and/or financial services industries
• Familiarity with infrastructure management and operations lifecycle concepts and ecosystem
• Strong attention to detail with ability to interact with stakeholders and key vendors reporting roadmaps, status and risks
• Passionate about technology with an interest in the latest trends in DevOps/SRE/Exchange engineering
• Comfort working in a rapidly evolving environment and managing through ambiguity.
• Ability to interface with cross-functional teams internally and externally
• Desire to continuously learn and improve individual competencies as well as team

title: Software Developer
text:
• Develop various aspects of the Hedera Hashgraph Platform.
• Develop sample applications to demonstrate value and strength of the platform. Sample applications will include web, mobile and embedded development.
• Assist 3rd party developers in the development of a wide range of applications based on the Hedera platform, including financial transactions, gaming and database applications.
• Be a strong and proficient hands-on programmer, spending 80% of your time coding.
• Familiarity with and interest in mathematical concepts, principles and techniques
• Systems programming experience including providing services to other software (e.g.operating systems, computational science applications, game engines and AAA video games, industrial automation and software as a service applications)
• Proficiency in Java with knowledge of ecosystem of libraries and tools
• Deep knowledge of and experience with the Java VM, covering its strengths and weaknesses
• Experience in developing libraries and platforms for use and deployment by application developers
• Strong engineering principles and processes aimed at developing simple, modular and high-quality code
• Familiarity with test-driven software development processes and continuous integration tools and systems
• Experience with blockchain (e.g., Bitcoin or Ethereum) and distributed applications is a big plus
• Bachelor of Science or Master of Science degree, preferably from a high-credentialed school in Computer Science or similar discipline.
• The preferred experience with architectural design, but would consider someone with less experience with the right combination of skills.

We are a fast-growing company built around a revolutionary technology — the hashgraph consensus algorithm. Hedera Hashgraph is well-suited to become the world's first mass-adopted distributed public ledger because it is blazing fast, highly secure and ensures fairness. We are on a mission to create a trusted and empowered digital future for everyone; a cyberspace where you work, play, buy, sell, create, and engage socially; where you have safety and privacy in your digital communities; where you feel confident when interacting with others; where you own and control your information.Hedera is ambitious and fast-paced. We balance our enthusiasm with a measured approach to risk, and are well capitalized having raised over $100-million. Today, our team consists of more than 60 talented individuals, including many of the best minds in the industry. We are proud of our high-quality culture, dedicated to our values of integrity, ethics, service, excellence and teamwork.We are looking to hire effective, collegial and hard-working people to help achieve our vision. Join us and say, "Hello future."

title: Security Operations Analyst
text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.



Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

In the emerging industry of digital assets, there is nothing more important than trust (which is why Gemini’s very first hires were Security experts). The Gemini Security team forms the backbone of all that we do and is as diverse as the number of challenges we tackle in the crypto space. From security architecture and engineering to maintenance of cold storage systems and data centers to cybersecurity and litigation support, our team ensures that our customers, clients, and employees are safe, secure, and supported.

Gemini is looking for an Information Security Operations Analyst to join our growing information security operations team. In this role, you will report directly to the Security Operations Lead and we be part of a team responsible for monitoring, operations, investigations and response to events within the Gemini environment.
• Analyze data feeds for event detection, and perform correlation analysis on data from multiple monitoring sources.
• Analyze data, perform research, and verify information for potential misconduct or abnormal behavior.
• Respond to cybersecurity events and incidents caused by internal and external threats, coordinate response activities with various stakeholders for confirmed incidents, and recommend mitigation strategies. This can involve non-traditional working hours.
• Proactively hunt within Gemini’s environment utilizing a variety of tools and techniques
• Utilize data mining tools to collect, search, sort, and organize large amounts of information.
• Partner with cross-functional technical teams to share expertise, research threats, and implement solutions.
• Produce reports, summaries, and other forms of communication that may be both internal and client facing, to include leadership and executive management.
• Draft root cause analysis reports and recommendations after cybersecurity incidents.
• Stay current with Security technologies and make recommendations for use based on business value
• Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to interact effectively with executives, engineers, vendors and peers.
• Team player required. Must be able to interact with peers, management, and senior engineers in a constantly evolving environment to ensure a positive team experience and atmosphere in the workplace.
• Understanding of IT operations: help desk, endpoint management and server management

text:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

In Design Tech, we think comfort zones are the enemy of creativity. A dynamic team of designers, engineers, researchers, our team blends beauty with tech to create a world-class product interface for our exchange. We are inspired by design, fueled by data, and obsessed with the user, both retail and institution.

Our growing Product & Design team is looking for an experienced, data driven UX designer. In this role, you will take a customer centric approach to decide and solve for the flow of design solutions and create an incredible user experience. You will use AB testing and data to build, iterate upon, and perfect the Gemini exchange across all platforms. You will work cross-functionally with our Exchange and Mobile product teams.
• Translate business requirements and user research findings into elegant solutions for complex product problems
• Think through user personas producing storyboards, user flows, wireframes, and mockups that define the user experience on both our retail and institutional products
• Collaborate with a cross-functional team that includes engineers, product managers in order to ensure a high-quality implementation of designs
• Minimum 5 years experience with a portfolio that showcases a user-centered approach to design
• Demonstrates an in depth understanding and knowledge of user-centered design activities from research, concepting, flows, sitemaps, wireframes, prototypes, annotations, and more.
• Extensive experience with Sketch, Adobe CS (i.e. Photoshop and Illustrator), and the Google suite of apps
• Strong organizational, communication and conceptual thinking skills as well as attention to detail
• Team player and self-starter with a passion for design and finding smart solutions to complex problems
• Has a collaborative mindset with strong point of view paired with a healthy dose of humility

It Pays to Work Here

We take a holistic approach to compensation at Gemini, which includes:
• Ownership in the company via profit sharing units

Gemini is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

As our Art Director at Gemini, you’ll form the cornerstone of content. You’ll join a dynamic team of innovative UI and UX designers and developers working to bring our user experience to the next level. The Art Director will liaise directly with our Marketing & Communications teams to create the most compelling and creative video, ad, and social content. • Evolve, explore and apply our visual identity; become fully immersed in the Gemini brand and mission

• Generate clear ideas, concepts and designs of creative assets from beginning to end
• Execute and produce a mix of graphic, motion, and photographic content
• Collaborate with a cross-functional team that includes marketing, engineers, and product managers in order to create compelling content for the user

• Strong organizational, communication and conceptual thinking skills, as well as attention to detail
• Team player and self-starter with a passion for design and finding smart solutions to complex problems
• Is an experienced multi-tasker and is not intimidated by the thought of juggling multiple projects and tasks at once
• Crafts stories and build brands through campaign level thinking and execution
• Can translate strategy into design across print, web, mobile and video
• 1-2 years acting as Art Director or senior visual designer at a digital agency or in-house
• Ability to synthesize complex, interdependent, and sometimes competing needs
• Expert level skills in Adobe creative suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects), the Google suite of apps, and a working knowledge of Sketch/Figma as well as emerging interactive design trends
• Experience in design targeting users within the finance, technology, or fintech industries specifically
• Is a creative thinker who embraces challenges and new methods of thinking beyond the tasks at hand with a holistic and methodical approach

text:

title: Blockchain Solutions Architect
text:
Our Blockchain/Digital Architect role is to be a trusted consultant to our clients around the development and deployment of innovative and transformational blockchain digital strategies, business solutions, and products. This role will bring together digital objects, technology, and business solutions in a way that will enable our clients to connect with individuals, communities, and humanity in interactive ways never thought possible.
